page.title: 03CEREMONIES OF CASTLETON
page.content: A nightly curfew has been rung voluntarily from the Church Tower since Norman times. It is rung from September to March except on Sunday nights. Few people help now. Unusual lead miners' Christmas carols have been sung each December for over a hundred years.They are sung in church or chapel and in the George Hotel. Fewer people sing them nowadays.An August gymkhana is held for pony events.For the last 15 Years there's been a Church Festival of Art and Craft,done by the villagers.It attracts 6,000 people annually.Each year since 1970 many illuminated Christmas trees are erected in the village.In 1984 there were 65 trees.Each August is Sports Family Day.Each November is bonfire night with a firework display.For both the last 2 events,admission is free.
